get.summary: For fetching all partition keys for the estimates. Part of our pagination for fetching estimates.
get.description: Get all of partition keys for the estimates in our database.

get.summary: For fetching all primary seroprevalence estimates associated with a particular partition key for use in the FAO's Empres-I dashboard.
get.description: Get primary MERS viral and seroprevalence estimates from our database.

parameters.name: partitionKey
parameters.description: The partition key to get data for. Calling this endpoint for each partition key returned by /fao/merstracker-primary-estimate-partitions will give the full dataset.

id.description: A MongoDB ObjectId which is unique for this primary estimate.

estimateId.description: A string that is unique to this primary estimate.

geographicalAreaSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by geographic region (Ex. one sampled population was in Calgary, Alberta and another was in Toronto, Ontario).

ageGroupSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by age group (Ex. one sampled population was exclusively children under the age of 18 and another consisted exclusively of seniors above the age of 60).

testUsedSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by test used (Ex. one sampled population was tested using a particular test and another was tested using another).

animalSpeciesSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by the species of animal (Ex. one sampled population was only camels and another was only cattle).

sexSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by sex (Ex. one sampled population was exclusively female and another was mixed).

timeFrameSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by time sampled (Ex. one population was sampled between 2024-04-30 and 2024-05-07 while another was sampled between 2024-06-07 and 2024-06-13).

sampleTypeSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by specimen type (Ex. one population was tested using their blood and another was tested using their urine).

occupationSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by the occupation of the sampled population (Ex. one subestimate might consist of camel farmers and another might consist of healthcare workers).

animalSourceLocationSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by the country of the animal's origin, which can be different than where the animal had it's sample taken (Ex. one subestimate might consist of camels which are local to Saudi Arabia and another might consist of camels which were tested in Saudi Arabia but imported from Sudan).

animalSamplingContextSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by the sample frame of the animal (Ex. one subestimate might show the prevalence measured among camels living on a farm while another might show the prevalence measured among camels living in a quarantine centre).

camelExposureLevelSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by the population's exposure level to camels (Ex. one subestimate might show the prevalence measured among those with direct exposure to camels while another might show the prevalence measured among those with no direct exposure to camels).

nomadismSubestimates.description: Subestimates which break down the prevalence further by the population's relationship to nomadism (Ex. one subestimate might show the prevalence measured among the nomadic portion of the total sampled population while another might show the prevalence measured among non-nomadic portion of the sampled population).

id.description: A MongoDB ObjectId which is unique for this primary estimate information entry.

estimateId.description: A string that is unique to this primary estimate.

country.description: A string representation of the name of the country where the sampling was conducted. Conforms to the WHO's country name list.

city.description: A string representation of the name of the city where the sampling was conducted.

state.description: A string representation of the name of the state where the sampling was conducted.

district.description: A string representation of the name of the district where the sampling was conducted.

countryAlphaTwoCode.description: A country code for where the sampling was conducted. Conforms to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 spec.

countryAlphaThreeCode.description: A country code for where the sampling was conducted. Conforms to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 spec.

latitude.description: An approximate latitude for the location where sampling was conducted

longitude.description: An approximate longitude for the location where sampling was conducted

whoRegion.description: The WHO region where the sampling was conducted.

unRegion.description: The UN region where the sampling was conducted.

firstAuthorFullName.description: The full name of the first author of the study.

sourceUrl.description: A url to the source where this estimate was derived from.

sourceType.description: The type of the source where this estimate was derived from.

sourceTitle.description: The title of the source where this estimate was derived from.
sourceTitle.example: Cross-sectional study of MERS-CoV-specific RNA and antibodies in animals that have had contact with MERS patients in Saudi Arabia

institution.description: The name of the institution which published the source where this estimate was derived from.

studyInclusionCriteria.description: A description of the study's inclusion criteria.
studyInclusionCriteria.example: This was part of a cooperative epidemiological response to the confirmed human cases of MERS with a history of animal contact. Notifications were issued by the Ministry of Health (MOH) associated with animals with a history of contact with MERS-patients

studyExclusionCriteria.description: A description of the study's exclusion criteria.
studyExclusionCriteria.example: Camels who had been outside Saudi Arabia in the past four months were excluded.

sensitivity.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the sensitivity of the test used as a percentage.

sensitivity95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the sensitivity of the test as a percentage.

sensitivity95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the sensitivity of the test as a percentage.

sensitivityDenominator.description: The sample size used when testing for sensitivity

specificity.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the specificity of the test used as a percentage.

specificity95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the specificity of the test as a percentage.

specificity95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the specificity of the test as a percentage.

specificityDenominator.description: The sample size used when testing for specificity

sampleNumerator.description: The number of positive cases within the population sampled.

sampleDenominator.description: The number of people or animals within the population sampled.

assay.description: The test(s) used to determine positivity.

specimenType.description: The type(s) of specimen extracted for the test

sex.description: The sex of the population sampled.

socioeconomicStatus.description: The socioeconomic status of the population sampled.

exposureToCamels.description: The exposure level to camels in the population sampled.

antigen.description: The antigen(s) or gene(s) tested for. Multiple values indicate an AND (Ex. Positive for UpE and N)

samplingStartDate.description: The time when sampling started. Confirms to the ISO 8601 standard.

samplingMidDate.description: A time representing the middle of the sampling timeframe. Confirms to the ISO 8601 standard.

samplingEndDate.description: The time when sampling ended. Confirms to the ISO 8601 standard.

geographicScope.description: Whether this study is a national study, a regional study, or a local study.

testProducer.description: The producers of the test used for determining positivity

testProducerOther.description: If the test producer is "Other", this field indicates what the test producer is.

testValidatedOn.description: What species the test was tested on.

positiveCutoff.description: The positive cutoff for the testing. Values can vary greatly from estimate to estimate.
positiveCutoff.example: Antibody titres of = 1:20 on neutralization assay

symptomPrevalenceOfPositives.description: The symtom prevalence of the population determined positive.

symptomDefinition.description: The definition used when determining whether someone displays symptoms and should be included in symptomPrevalenceOfPositives.

testValidation.description: The validation used for the sensitivity and specificty measurements

sequencingDone.description: Whether or not genomic sequencing was done.

clade.description: The clades from the genomic sequencing. Always empty if sequencingDone is false.

accessionNumbers.description: The accession numbers relating to the genomic sequencing. Always null if sequencingDone is false.

genomeSequenced.description: The genomes sequenced. Always empty if sequencingDone is false.

seroprevalence.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the seroprevalence as a percentage.

seroprevalence95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for seroprevalence as a percentage.

seroprevalence95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for seroprevalence as a percentage.

ageGroup.description: The age group(s) captured in the study.

sampleFrame.description: The population sampled in the study.

seroprevalence.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the seroprevalence as a percentage.

seroprevalence95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for seroprevalence as a percentage.

seroprevalence95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for seroprevalence as a percentage.

animalSpecies.description: The species of animal that was primarily sampled for this study.

animalType.description: Whether the animal is a wild animal or a domestic animal. Includes both values if the population included both.

animalDetectionSettings.description: The population(s) sampled in the study.

animalPurpose.description: A description of the animal's purpose.

animalImportedOrLocal.description: Whether the animal is local or imported.

animalAgeGroup.description: The age group(s) captured in the study.

positivePrevalence.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the positive viral prevalence as a percentage.

positivePrevalence95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the positive viral prevalence as a percentage.

positivePrevalence95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the positive viral prevalence as a percentage.

items.description: The age group(s) captured in the study.

sampleFrame.description: The population sampled in the study.

positivePrevalence.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the positive viral prevalence as a percentage.

positivePrevalence95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the positive viral prevalence as a percentage.

positivePrevalence95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the positive viral prevalence as a percentage.

animalSpecies.description: The species of animal that was primarily sampled for this study.

animalType.description: Whether the animal is a wild animal or a domestic animal. Includes both values if the population included both.

animalDetectionSettings.description: The population(s) sampled in the study.

animalPurpose.description: A description of the animal's purpose.

animalImportedOrLocal.description: Whether the animal is local or imported.

animalAgeGroup.description: The age group captured in the study.

sampleNumerator.description: The number of positive cases within the population sampled.

sampleDenominator.description: The number of people or animals within the population sampled.

seroprevalence.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the seroprevalence as a percentage.

seroprevalence95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for seroprevalence as a percentage.

seroprevalence95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for seroprevalence as a percentage.

sampleNumerator.description: The number of positive cases within the population sampled.

sampleDenominator.description: The number of people or animals within the population sampled.

positivePrevalence.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the virual positive prevalence as a percentage.

positivePrevalence95CILower.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the viral positive prevalence as a percentage.

positivePrevalence95CIUpper.description: A number from 0 to 1.00 which represents the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the viral positive prevalence as a percentage.

id.description: A MongoDB ObjectId which is unique for this subestimate.

estimateId.description: A string that is unique to this primary estimate.

country.description: A string representation of the name of the country where the sampling was conducted. Conforms to the WHO's country name list.

city.description: A string representation of the name of the city where the sampling was conducted.

state.description: A string representation of the name of the state where the sampling was conducted.

district.description: A string representation of the name of the district where the sampling was conducted.

countryAlphaTwoCode.description: A country code for where the sampling was conducted. Conforms to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 spec.

countryAlphaThreeCode.description: A country code for where the sampling was conducted. Conforms to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 spec.

latitude.description: An approximate latitude for the location where sampling was conducted

longitude.description: An approximate longitude for the location where sampling was conducted

whoRegion.description: The WHO region where the sampling was conducted.

unRegion.description: The UN region where the sampling was conducted.

geographicScope.description: Whether this study is a national study, a regional study, or a local study.

ageGroup.description: The age group(s) captured in the subestimate.

ageGroupLabel.description: A more in-depth description of the age groups captured in the subestimate
ageGroupLabel.example: Children between the ages of four and eight

animalAgeGroup.description: The age group(s) captured in the subestimate.

animalAgeGroupLabel.description: A more in-depth description of the age groups captured in the subestimate
animalAgeGroupLabel.example: Camels between the ages of eight and twelve months

assay.description: The test(s) used to determine positivity.

animalSpecies.description: The species of animal that was primarily sampled for this study.

sex.description: The sex of the population sampled.

samplingStartDate.description: The time when sampling started. Confirms to the ISO 8601 standard.

samplingEndDate.description: The time when sampling ended. Confirms to the ISO 8601 standard.

specimenType.description: The type(s) of specimen extracted for the test

occupation.description: The occupation of the population sampled

sampleFrame.description: The population sampled in the study.

exposureToCamels.description: The exposure level to camels in the population sampled.

animalImportedOrLocal.description: Whether the animal is local or imported.

animalCountryOfImport.description: A string representation of the name of the country where the animals were imported from. Conforms to the WHO's country name list.

animalCountryOfImportAlphaTwoCode.description: A country code for where the animals were imported from. Conforms to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 spec.

animalCountryOfImportAlphaThreeCode.description: A country code for where the animals were imported from. Conforms to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 spec.

animalDetectionSettings.description: The population(s) sampled in the study.

details.description: A brief description for this population's relationship to camels.
details.example: Community members not exposed to camels

sampleFrame.description: The population sampled in the study.

exposureToCamels.description: The exposure level to camels in the population sampled.

details.description: A brief description for this population's relationship to nomadism.
